intro: Tynanthus, commonly known as the golden dewdrop or yellow daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to the Americas and are characterized by their showy, yellow flowers that resemble daisies. Tynanthus species typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as their fruit type. They are often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. The genus includes several species, with Tynanthus pentaphyllus being one of the most well-known.
